DataElement.preferredName: Pelvis Mass Greater Than 5 Centimeter Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator for whether or not a benign or malignant mass greater than 5 centimeters is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pelvis Mass Greater Than Five Centimeter Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans._The amount of matter in an object._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one._A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

Concepts.definition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

Property.preferredName: Mass Greater Than Five Centimeter Present
Property.preferredDefinition: The amount of matter in an object.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.:A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The amount of matter in an object.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON
